result.execSummary:
The defendant Doshin Rivera was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/ Intent-THC (>1000-2500 grams), a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)3.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 2 days (03-05-2014 to 03-06-2014) time served.

miscConds.notes: Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge, during the course of probation to the probation agent. Any remaining balance due at the end of probation will become immediately due or civil judgment to be entered.  Fine set at zero.
No possession of any firearms or weapons, firearm ammunition, firearm magazine, firearm holster, or any body armor.

No possession of any drug paraphernalia for personal use, manufacturing, delivering or for distribution.
Defendant is not to possess cash currency in an amount greater than $300.00 at one time.
No possession of more than one cell phone at any one time.
Defendant may not have more than one phone number registered to you name at one time. 
Defendant to not associate with any known gang member, associate or affiliate.
No contact with Daniel A.
No use or possession/use of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.

Defendant to notify Department of Corrections agent of all prescriptions within 3 business days/72 hours of receiving prescription from medical professional.
Fill all prescriptions at one pharmacy, unless otherwise approved by Department of Corrections Agent, and notify the Department of Corrections agent of the pharmacy used. 
Court ordered Defendant to comply with all child support court orders.
Complete Parenting or Fatherhood course. 
Drivers license suspension set at ZERO. 
Provide DNA sample, if not already done.

Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment. Maintain Absolute Sobriety.
Department of Corrections must conduct drug and alcohol testing at least 1 time per month for the first 9 months of probation.

timeConds.notes:
**11-20-15/ Judge Carolina M Stark**
The Court ordered that the defendant shall serve the remaining balance of the six months of condition time WITHOUT release privileges for work, child care, and seeking employment/ engaging in employment training and WITH release privileges for inmate work assignments and Day Reporting Center.
It is also ordered that the defendant serve the entire six months of condition time without Good Time credit.                                                                          .

With good time credit; release for The Day Reporting Center, work, inmate work assignments, child care, and seeking employment or engaging in employment training. Court notes a strong objection to electronic monitoring. REPORT on 09-01-2015 at 1:15 pm in Safety Building, room 310.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Doshin Rivera

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: due date for assessments amended to 9/1/2017 based on Order signed on 9/1/17 which states defendant discharged from probation.

JUDGE PROTASIEWICZ FOR JUDGE ROSA
Order on Petition for Early Discharge from Probation, signed and filed. 
The Court orders: The petition is granted/The period of probation is modified to discharge the defendant from probation supervision on FORTHWITH.

Pursuant to current District Court Rules, this case is assigned and 
forwarded to Judge Rosa
 for review. os

Received from the Department of Corrections - Probation, request to:
[    ]   Extend Probation
[    ]   Set Restitution
[    ]   Remove Court Obligations
[x  ]   Review / Modify Probation
[    ]   Convert Unpaid Obligations to Civil Judgment
Adjourned Projected Guilty Plea for 2.24.16 @ 1:30 p.m.  Filed

Order Revoking Some Release Privileges and Revoking Possibility for Good Time Credit During Condition Time, signed and filed.  Copy forwarded to the House of Correction, the state, defense, and defendant.

THEREFORE, IT IS HEREBY ORDERED that the Defendant shall serve the remaining balance of the six months of condition time WITHOUT release privileges for work, child care, and seeking employment/engaging in employment training and WITH release privileges for inmate work assignments and day reporting center.

IT IS ALSO ORDERED that the Defendant serve the entire six months of condition time WITHOUT good time credit.

IT IS ALSO ORDERED that the Judgment of Conviction shall be amended to reflect this decision.

Huber/Work Release Modification Request
.
Request for Huber / Work Release Modification received from HOC and filed this date.  This case is assigned and forwarded to Judge Stark, Br 17, for review. os

Defendant Doshin Rivera in court with attorney Michael J Steinle.  Zachary A Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

AS TO COUNT 1 -
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 3 YEARS, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 2 days (03-05-2014 to 03-06-2014) time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 2 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 1 YEAR.  

Defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Substance Abuse Program. 

COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed defendant on probation for 30 MONTHS.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:

- Maintain Absolute Sobriety: No use or possession/use of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.
- Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment.  
- Department of Corrections must conduct drug and alcohol testing at least 1 time per month for the first 9 months of probation.
- Defendant to notify Department of Corrections agent of all prescriptions within 3 business days/ 72 hours of receiving prescription from medical professional.
- Fill all prescriptions at one pharmacy, unless otherwise approved by Department of Corrections Agent, and notify the Department of Corrections agent of the pharmacy used. 
- No possession of any drug paraphernalia for personal use, manufacturing, delivering or for distribution.
- Defendant is not to possess cash currency in an amount greater than $300.00 at one time.
- No possession of more than one cell phone at any one time.
- Defendant my not have more than one phone number registered to you name at one time. 
- No possession of any firearms or weapons, firearm ammunition, firearm magazine, firearm holster, or any body armor.
- Seek/Maintain fulltime employment. 
- Defendant to not associate with any known gang member, associate or affiliate. 
- No contact with Daniel A.
- Court ordered Defendant to comply with all child support court orders.
- Complete Parenting or Fatherhood course. 
- Fine is set at ZERO.
- Drivers license suspension set at ZERO. 
- Provide DNA sample, if not already done. 
- Court ordered defendant to serve 6 MONTHS CONDITION TIME in the House of Correction with goodtime credit; release for The Day Reporting Center, work, inmate work assignments, child care, and seeking employment or engaging in employment training. Court notes a strong objection to electronic monitoring. REPORT on 09-01-2015 at 1:15 pm in Safety Building, room 310.
- Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge, during the course of probation to the probation agent. Any remaining balance due at the end of probation will become immediately due or civil judgment to be entered. 

Appellate rights notice given to the defendant. 

Filed;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit.
Court orders the Condifential Memorandum (Stipulation) to be sealed and to remain in the court file. tk
Sentencing hearing on August 31, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Parties contacted the court to reschedule sentencing hearing on 08-11-2015 as ADA Wittchow is unavailable. Sentencing hearing rescheduled for 08-31-2015 at 8:30, branch 17.

Defendant Doshin Rivera in court with attorney Michael J Steinle.  Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
AS TO COUNT 1 - 
The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Jury Instructions and Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting. Case adjourned for sentencing hearing on 08-11-2015 at 8:30 am to Branch 17.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Doshin Rivera in court with attorney Michael J Steinle.  Zachary A Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
Held off the record.   Defense counsel request projected plea and sentencing hearing.  Court orders case for adjourned projected Plea and Sentencing, Branch 17.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 1, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Fiorenza.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Stark, Br. 17.

Defendant Doshin Rivera in court with attorney Michael J Steinle.  Zachary A Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Sark in Branch 17.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant plead not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered Defendant not to be in possession of any controlled subtances without a valid prescription; and no possession of any firearms or weapons.

Defendant Doshin Rivera in court with attorney Michael J Steinle.  Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Fiorenza, Branch3*.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.   Case is adjourned for a Preliminary Hearing in Branch PE.    DEFENDANT WAS ORDERED BY THE COURT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 3:00 P.M. ON  (05-15-2015). IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 26, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 5/14/15 @ 1:30 pm
